alert.note: Alert for Curry; De Baca; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 10:22PM MDT until May 31 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT...EASTERN DE BACA...SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES... At 1022 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles south of Taiban, or 20 miles southeast of Fort Sumner, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Floyd, House, Tolar and Taiban. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 317 and 360. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
